intro: Plagiobothrys pedicellaris, commonly known as the pedicellate bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Plagiobothrys pedicellaris is a perennial herb that blooms from spring to early summer.
